code:
export var immigrations=[{title:'VIP Airport Services',subTitle:'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists',content:[{title:'Who is this type of service for ?',description:"Do you feel uncomfortable at the time of entering?  Don’t worry, we provide the escort/accompaniment service at the time of arrival or departure to accelerate and smoothing the immigration document clearance in the Airport.

You don’t need to worry because our team is ready to help escort you during the immigration document examination process when you arrive in Indonesia.

Our team will help to pick you up and escort you on your arrival, with the aim that the process of inspecting all your immigration documents runs faster because you do not have to get through long queues. As a result, you will feel more relaxed and more comfortable when entering the process of inspecting travel documents and immigration documents at the airport.

The escort service we provide consists of two categories, namely:

  1.  Special pick-up and special assistance services at the time of inspection of travel documents and immigration documents only.
  2. Assistance during the inspection of travel and immigration documents and Baggage, until exiting the airport. (If there is a problem in relation to customs & excise matters, we cannot get involved).

Procedures:

We must have received upcoming guest data such as: passport scan, photo, photo visa, flight schedule scan, no later than 3 days before the scheduled arrival in Indonesia. We do not provide impromptu escort services (less than 2 days) before the date of arrival.

"}]},{title:'Overstay Settlement',subTitle:'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists',content:[{title:'Who is this type of service for ?',description:"

Overstay Settlement is specifically for foreigners who are already in Indonesia and have immigration problems with the category of serious violations in relation to immigration, namely in the form of long overstay. Nevertheless, you want to quickly solve your problem in a safe and affordable way. If you are someone who is facing such problems, you can contact us for a free consultation.

We are ready to assist you to resolve your problems with the immigration authorities. Even if you have a very limited budget to pay a huge overstay fine, we are ready to help you solve the problem without you being deported from Indonesia and without getting a red stamp on your passport (a stamp that indicates the owner has been deported). This red stamp means the owner will not be allowed to re-enter Indonesia and his visa application will be rejected for at least the next 6 months.

The exception is if the 6-month period has been exceeded and the applicant applies for a blocking exemption to the Indonesian immigration authorities. We can help you with the entire process and we will keep your personal data confidential until your issues with immigration authorities are resolved properly. We have helped many of our clients facing this kind of overstay problem during our more than 18-year career as a visa consultant.

"}]},{title:'Deportation Clearance',subTitle:'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists',content:[{title:'Who is this type of service for ?',description:"

Are you not able for re-entry to Indonesia after having been deported ?  No need to worry, we are able to help you settling your problem and handling the clearance/ending of your no entry by the immigration authority party in Indonesia.

For further information you are welcome to contact us …………………

"}]},{title:'Police Clearance Certificate (SKCK)',subTitle:'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists',content:[{title:'Who is this type of service for ?',description:"

Police Record Certificate (as known as SKCK), previously known as Certificate of Good Behavior, certificate is issued by the national police of Indonesia containing a criminal record of a person.
The certificate is available to expatriates or local Indonesians who require a confirmation of their criminal status. Applicants are not required to reside in Indonesia, the certificate is also available to applications who are no longer residing in Indonesia.

Police Record Certificate or SKCK is an official certificate issued by the Police through the security intelligence function to an applicant/citizen in the community to fulfill a request from the person concerned or a need due to a requisite provision, based on the results of research on biodata and existing Police records of a person. the. (Vide of National Police Chief Regulation No. 18 of 2014).
SKCK has a validity period of up to 6 (six) months from the date of issue. If the validity period has passed and if deemed necessary, the SKCK can be extended by the person concerned.

Most applicants require a Statement of Police Report (Surat Keterangan Catatan Kepolisian, SKCK) for the purposes of managing their immigration documents. It is because they live in another country, not in their own country. Usually, almost in all countries, the local government always asks for and requires Statement of Police Report or also called a Certificate of Good Conduct (Surat Keterangan Kelakuan Baik) from the Police in a country where the visa applicant has lived for a long time. This procedure must be carried out before issuing a residence permit to a foreigner who is applying for a residence permit in the applicant’s destination country.

"},{title:'Application procedure :',description:"

The application procedure consists of 2 steps:

• The application must first obtain a recommendation at the local police station; and
• Based on the recommendation of the local police station, the Police Headquarters (MABES POLRI) will issue a Statement of Police Report (SKCK);

If the applicant during the SKCK application is residing in Indonesia, the applicant’s fingerprint must be taken at the local police station.

If the SKCK applicant lives outside Indonesia, the applicant does not need to travel to Indonesia, as their presence in Indonesia is not required. In this case, fingerprinting can be done in the country where the applicant is residing. Fingerprinting can be taken at a local authority agency or police station, or notary, depending on the applicable regulations in the applicant’s country of residence.

"},{title:'Requirements to obtain a Statement of Police Report (SKCK)',description:"

The Indonesian Police have stipulated regulations for people who are eligible to obtain a Statement of Police Report (SKCK). The followings are the requirements for SKCK applicants:

  • All Indonesian citizens; and
  • Foreigners who currently live in Indonesia and have work permits and residence permits (KITAS) or foreigners who have left the territory of Indonesia and do not return, but have previously had work permits and residence permits (KITAS).

Application requirements for foreigners residing outside Indonesia.

  1. Latest Passport
  2. Proof of having a residence visa/KITAS in Indonesia
  3. Latest leaving stamp in the passport at the time of leaving the territory of Indonesia
  4. Passport Identity Page, Passport Cover, and Visa Stamping in passport
  5. Previous address in Indonesia
  6. Name of sponsoring company in Indonesia
  7. Application letter from the sponsoring company + KTP/ID Card of the application’s signatory
  8. Work permits/IMTA documents
  9. Purpose of obtaining SKCK
  10. The applicant’s original fingerprint on special paper for fingerprints issued/made by the local authority.
  11. Passport Photo 4cm x 6cm = 6 photos (yellow background)
  12. Letterhead of the sponsoring company
  13. Letter of employment agreement while working in Indonesia
  14. The applicant’s religion
  15. The period of stay in Indonesia from the year of ….. until …..
"}]},{title:'Travel Permit Certificate (SKJ)',subTitle:'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists',content:[{title:'What is Travel Permit (SKJ) ?',description:"

Travel Permit (Surat Keterangan Jalan, SKJ) is a certificate to travel for foreigners issued by the Indonesian Police.

For foreigners who are already in Indonesia and wish to travel/visit to other areas that are listed as conflict-prone areas, before going, you must first have a travel permit from the Indonesian police called Surat Keterangan Jalan (SKJ).

The standard processing time to obtain Travel Permit is approximately 3 working days and the express process will only take 1 working day.

For you who need a Travel Permit, please contact us. Our friendly team is ready to help you obtain a Travel Permit (SKJ) with an express or standard process.

"}]},{title:'Immigration Documents',subTitle:'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists',content:[{title:'IMMIGRATION CONSULTATION',description:"

The immigration problem is very complex and wider than just visa problem or in other words, visa problem is only one part of the immigration problems. For foreigners who are about to visit or live in Indonesia, then all types of existing immigration matters would be inevitable beginning from the time entering Indonesia’s area, also after being in the Indonesia’s area, every foreigner must be in contact with the immigration party and will be confronted with a number of immigration regulations that must be complied with. And our duty here is that we must always keep all our clients away from performing mistakes resulted from the lack of knowledge and information concerning the existing immigration regulations by means of always guiding and giving the true and latest information with the objective that all our clients may feel the comfort and satisfaction during their stay in Indonesia with the expectation that they would miss to again visit Indonesia.

 

We provide consultation services for those who need complete and up-to-date information on issues surrounding Indonesian immigration such as issues regarding passports, visas, residence permits, work permits, overstays, relocations, and issues of obtaining Indonesian citizenship status. For you who need this service, please contact our team to make a meeting schedule at our office. Our team of immigration experts is ready to help you find the best solution to whatever immigration law problems you are currently facing.

"},{title:'EPO (KITAS CANCELLATION)',description:"

EPO is the process of applying for a stay visa/KITAS cancellation for foreigners who will end their working period at a company in Indonesia or will not extend their visa because they will return to their home country or will move to work for another company in Indonesia. However, for you who are KITAS holders who are already stay outside Indonesia and will not return in the near future, then you or your person in Indonesia must still report your KITAS cancellation to the local immigration office using the term as referred to “Exit No Return”.

"},{title:'KITAS ADDRESS MUTATION',description:"

For foreigners holding stay visas/KITAS who have changed their residential address or moved to a different address even though they are still in the same housing complex but in a different unit, according to immigration regulations, these foreigners are required to report the change in address to the local immigration office. If you don’t report the change in address, you will be deemed to have violated immigration regulations.

For of you who do not have time to manage yourself and need help from an agent, please contact us. Our team is ready to help you process your change in residential address at the immigration office.

"},{title:'IMMIGRATION CERTIFICATE (SKIM)',description:"

Immigration certificate / SKIM is a certificate issued by the local immigration office for foreigners holding KITAS or KITAP who will apply for Indonesian citizenship. This SKIM can be given by the immigration if the foreigner applicants have lived for 5 consecutive years using a stay visa/KITAS sponsored by an Indonesian Citizen spouse or a company for foreign investors. The duration of the SKIM process is around 3-4 weeks.

"},{title:'CERTIFICATE FOR CHILDREN WITH DUAL CITIZENSHIP',description:"

This Certificate for Children with Dual Citizenship is intended to be given to a child born from mixed marriages between Indonesian Citizen & Foreigner parents, and the child does not yet have a foreign passport. Without having this certificate, the child will not be able to get an Indonesian passport. This certificate can only be issued by the local immigration office in the area according to the residential address of the parents written on the Resident Identity Card of the parents.

"},{title:'AFFIDAVIT CERTIFICATE',description:"

An Affidavit card is given to a child born from mixed marriages between Indonesian Citizen & Foreigner parents and the child already has a foreign passport. If the child does not have a foreign passport, he will not be able to get an Affidavit card from the local immigration in Indonesia.

"},{title:'PASSPORT',description:"

For all of you Indonesian citizens who need passports but you do not have time to manage it yourself due to your business and need help from an agent to process a passport, you can contact us. Our team is ready to help you process your passport at the immigration office in Jakarta.

"}]},{title:'Other Important Documents',subTitle:'Indonesia Visa & Immigration Specialists',content:[{title:'NPWP CARD / TIN',description:"

For all of you Indonesian citizens who do not have NPWP/ TIN cards and need help get the NPWP/ TIN cards from the tax office, please contact us. Our team is ready to help you get the NPWP in your name in a short time.

"},{title:'CHANGE IN KTP ADDRESS',description:"

For Indonesian Citizens who have moved their residential address to another city and want to change their residential address data on their Resident Identity Cards /KTP with new addresses, we can help get new Resident Identity Cards / KTP with new addresses. Changing the address on the Resident Identity Cards/KTP is sometimes very necessary to facilitate the process of obtaining other important documents in a new residential area. For example, Resident Identity Cards/KTP  are required to get a Certificate for Children with Dual Citizenship from the immigration office to get an Indonesian passport for children from mixed marriages between Indonesian Citizen and Foreigner parents.

"}]}];export default immigrations;
